Add assertions to document critical assumptions
commitResults.messageBody:
Add assert statements in TaskManager.validateIndex() to ensure that the
provided index is within the bounds of the task list, and in
TaskManager.createTask() to confirm that the input is not null or empty.
Also, add an assertion in Deadline.setBy() to verify that the new due
date is not null.

Additionally, update Parser.parse() to assert that the input is neither
null nor empty. These assertions help catch programming errors early and
serve as documentation of important assumptions.

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve code quality in task status updates
commitResults.messageBody:
Refactor TaskManager.markTask() and unmarkTask() by extracting a helper
method (formatStatusChangeMessage) to format status change messages.
This reduces code duplication and improves readability in the task
management logic.

This change follows code quality principles by promoting code reuse and
clear separation of formatting logic.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add assertions for validation
Add assertion in addTask method to ensure tasks is not null
Fix missing assert for index bounds check
refactor(task-manager): extract formatStatusChangeMessage helper for status updates
commitResults.messageBody:
TaskManager.markTask() and unmarkTask() contain duplicated code for
formatting status change messages, making the task management logic
harder to read. This duplication increases maintenance effort and risks
inconsistency.

Refactor TaskManager.markTask() and unmarkTask() by extracting a helper
method, formatStatusChangeMessage, to handle status message formatting.
This reduces code duplication, improves readability, and aligns with
code quality principles like reusability and separation of concerns.

This change targets the task status update logic specifically and does
not alter the core task marking functionality.

commitResults.messageTitle: Resolve merge conflicts in Parser and TaskManager
Add snooze feature to postpone deadline tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
Users cannot reschedule deadlines, limiting flexibility in task
management.

Add SnoozeCommand to parse "snooze [task number] [yyyy-mm-dd]" format.
Update TaskManager to modify deadline due dates and confirm changes.
Implement setter in Deadline class to update due dates. Extend Parser to
recognize "snooze" command.

Enable this feature to improve usability by allowing task postponement
with a simple, date-specific command structure consistent with existing
syntax.

This change enhances functionality without altering core task handling
logic.
